H3.text: where was the boston tea party 1773. Boston Harbor

A4.text: Disguised as Native Americans, on the night of December 16 members of Sons of Liberty boarded the Dartmouth, a merchantman that had docked in Boston carrying a major shipment of EIC tea, and set about throwing 342 chests of the tea into Boston Harbor.
